text: There are deadly diseases; there are others that, although not fatal, cause disease and are diagnosed without much study; finally, there are others that are only known by microscope and manifest themselves horribly after being diagnosed. The microscope is a kind of hypochondria. If men are dedicated to thorough study of microscopic diseases, they will have the satisfaction of getting sick every day. Finished Aphorisms, 1773
title: Satisfacción
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg
